<tr>
<td class="editors_note" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;padding: 0px 40px 16px 40px; border-left: 2px solid #353535; border-right: 2px solid #353535; border-bottom: 2px solid #353535; border-collapse: collapse; border-radius: 0px 0px 10px 10px;">
<div style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;">
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Good morning. </strong>A dispatch from the heartwarming news department: </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">When travel was shutting down last spring, Delta pilot Chris Dennis parked a plane in the desert and left a note to the person who would fly it next.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><em>Hey pilots, i</em><em>t’s March 23rd and we just arrived from MSP. Very chilling to see so much of our fleet here in the desert. If you are here to pick it up then the light must be at the end of the tunnel. Amazing how fast it changed. Have a safe flight bringing it out of storage!</em></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">The note was found 435 days later when another pilot brought the plane back into service last week.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;font-family:flood-std, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-weight:500">—Neal Freyman</p>
</div>

Q&A
</p>
</td>

<div style="text-align: center; background: linear-gradient(90deg, #2b9295, #1c7ff2); background-color: #1c7ff2; line-height: 4px; font-size: 4px; width: 100%; margin: 20px 0;">

<tr class="">
<td class="column" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;font-size: 0px; padding: 25px; word-break: break-word;">
<div style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;">
<h1 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">
Icebreakers with… <em>Insecure</em>'s Yvonne Orji
</h1>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/11/icebreakers-insecures-yvonne-orji?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none; border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Headshot of Yvonne Orji" style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NDExL3l2b25uZV9vcmppLmpwZWciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;">
<small>
<em>Courtesy of Yvonne Orji</em>
</small>
</p>
</a>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">It's unclear what people talked about in group chats before <em>Insecure</em> graced us with its hilarious plotlines, juicy drama, and, of course, Emmy-nominated Yvonne Orji. If you haven't finished the latest season, that's OK, because there are plenty of other places to find Orji: her HBO standup special from last summer, her new book <a href="https://www.hachettebookgroup.com/titles/yvonne-orji/bamboozled-by-jesus/9781546012696/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Bamboozled By Jesus</em></a><em>, </em>or her upcoming show for Disney+, <em>First Gen</em>, that charts her experience growing up as a Nigerian immigrant in the US (her co-producer: Oprah).</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">We asked the actor, writer, comedian, and producer a few icebreakers.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Your character in </strong><strong><em>Insecure</em></strong><strong>, Molly, is so focused on her job that it interferes with her personal life. How do you, Yvonne, balance your personal life and career?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">That's something that I'm just now starting to do. I'm where a lot of people want Molly to be, which is finding that balance. But self-care is my love language. I have standing massage appointments, therapy, all the things.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Is there anything you're looking forward to doing after wrapping up </strong><strong><em>Insecure</em></strong><strong> and releasing your book?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Girl, by the grace of God, I plan on being in Bali for a full month.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>What's your pump-up song?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Before I went in to pitch my show for Oprah, back in 2015, my roommate was like, "Do you have a hype song?" I was so nervous. I was just trying to get my pitch down, but she was like, "No, no, no, you need to have a song." And so I played "I'm a Boss" by Meek Mill on constant rotation. That was and has been my hype song for a long time.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>If you could write anything on a billboard, what would it be?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">"Why not me?" I would love to be in my car, feeling down, and then look up and see a billboard that says "Why not me?" You're right! Why not me?</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Have you ever had a "Why not me?" moment?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Oh man. I still have those moments. Seeing that books like <a href="https://www.purposedriven.com/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>The Purpose Driven Life</em></a> or <a href="https://www.thesecret.tv/products/the-secret-book/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>The Secret</em></a><em> </em>sold like a gazillion million copies before the internet...I was like, if this older white man and this older white woman can sell gazillions of books [by] pretty much talking about faith, why not me?</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>What's a reality show you think you could win?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><em>Lip Sync Battle</em>. God did not give me a singing voice.</p>

</h1>

<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Formula 1 racing is complicated. <em>Extremely complicated</em>. Trying to figure out how to turn a car into a steerable ground rocketship? No thanks. We can barely toast a bagel.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">So when the McLaren F1 Team needed to turn to hybrid work over the past year, it’s safe to say they needed a solution that <strong>made virtual collaboration seamless</strong>. When communication and precision are key to your performance, you need a collab tool to keep up. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">McLaren’s pick was obvious: <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N7442.3407870MORNINGBREW/B25957551.305077297;dc_trk_aid=497873726;dc_trk_cid=152108492;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=;ltd=" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Webex</a>.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">With Webex, McLaren is collaborating like they never have before. (Just look at how happy Lando looks up there.) And who can blame him?! In a sport where precision is paramount, Webex enables real-time communication for the McLaren Formula 1 Team.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N7442.3407870MORNINGBREW/B25957551.305077297;dc_trk_aid=497873726;dc_trk_cid=152108492;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=;ltd=" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Learn more about how Webex is driving hybrid work</a>.</p>

<td class="column" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;font-size: 0px; padding: 25px; word-break: break-word;">
<div style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;">
<h1 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">
Make It Work: Balancing Work and Life
</h1>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/11/make-work-balancing-work-life?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none; border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Make It Work logo" style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80Njg5L21ha2VfaXRfd29ya19sb2dvLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;">
<small>
<em></em>
</small>
</p>
</a>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Each week, Morning Brew's Head of People Ops Kate Noel answers <a href="https://link.morningbrew.com/click/23923023.14227/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJld2RhaWx5LnR5cGVmb3JtLmNvbS90by9mWTFDR3p5WT91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77B1c068d44?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reader-submitted questions</a> about work in 2021. Today she's tag-teaming with Lily Mittman, our Director of Talent Acquisition.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Hi! I’m actively interviewing for an entry-level marketing role and have been asked about salary expectations in the final round. How should I answer this question without negotiating myself down accidentally?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Comp questions can be really hard to navigate! I prefer to have these conversations upfront, because I want candidates to know they're interviewing for a position that they'd be excited to accept an offer for. The safest bet is to provide a salary range that would work for you. Think about what number you'd be comfortable walking away from as your low, and your slam-dunk-signing-the-offer-on-the-spot number as your high. You can always add in those magic words, "negotiable!"</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"> —Lily </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>I find I am constantly overworked and lack a proper work-life balance. Everyone at the company also works a lot. How do I find my work-life balance at this company? I don’t want to leave.</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">I feel you—work-life balance is something I struggle with also, but I’ve recently gotten better after this realization: “<em>No one’s going to bite your head off if their email isn’t answered at 9pm</em>.” You need to start setting expectations for yourself and for your coworkers that some parts of the day are off-limits for work matters. Once you decide what those are (for example, not opening your computer before 8:30am), you can use a variety of tools to broadcast to your coworkers that you’re actually living life, not pounding away at your keyboard. I use Slack away messages to tell folks that I’m not reachable, or I turn off Slack notifications at night.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">I think it’s very important you bring your work-life balance into ~balance~ because even if you don’t want to leave your company <em>now</em>, you may want to leave in the future due to burnout. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">—Kate</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><em>Something bothering you at work? </em><a href="https://link.morningbrew.com/click/23923023.14227/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJld2RhaWx5LnR5cGVmb3JtLmNvbS90by9mWTFDR3p5WT91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77B1c068d44?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Ask Kate here</em></a><em>.</em></p>

<td style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;border: 2px solid #353535; background: white; margin: 0px; padding: 10px;">
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;word-break: keep-all; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center; text-transform: uppercase; font-family: Georgia, 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-weight: 700; font-size: 16px; line-height: 18px; color: #353535; padding: 0px; margin: 0px;">
ANALYSIS
</p>
</td>
<td width="33%" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt">
<div style="text-align: center; background: linear-gradient(90deg, #2b9295, #1c7ff2); background-color: #1c7ff2; line-height: 4px; font-size: 4px; width: 100%; margin: 20px 0;">
 
</div>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="">
<td class="column" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;font-size: 0px; padding: 25px; word-break: break-word;">
<div style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;">
<h1 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">
The Boring Company Says "Open Sesame"
</h1>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/11/boring-company-says-open-sesame?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none; border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="At a Boring Company debut in Las Vegas, a white Tesla sedan drives into a futuristic looking tunnel lit up blue on the inside." style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NDE1L2JvcmluZ19jb21wYW55LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;">
<small>
<em>Ethan Miller/Getty Images</em>
</small>
</p>
</a>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Attendees at the World of Concrete convention in Las Vegas last week—the first major trade show since the pandemic began—made history in another way, too: They were among the first riders on the inaugural transportation system operated by The Boring Company, Elon Musk's grand vision for revolutionizing transit.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">If you're envisioning futuristic pods that whisk travelers through high-tech underground tunnels at NASCAR speeds, as Elon Musk initially promised, the Las Vegas Convention Center Loop is <a href="https://www.cnet.com/news/elon-musks-boring-loop-is-finally-transporting-passengers-in-las-vegas/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">not that</a>. Human-driven Teslas shuttle visitors from one end of the vast complex to the other, reducing a 25-minute walk to a two-minute underground ride. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">In all, it was a rather, uh, boring debut for the Boring Company, a venture Musk created after he became fed up with LA gridlock. "Traffic is driving me nuts. Am going to build a tunnel boring machine and just start digging..." he <a href="https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/810108760010043392?s=20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tweeted</a> in 2016.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">So he did—or at least tried to. The Boring Company <a href="https://www.fastcompany.com/90644133/elon-musk-boring-company-vegas-teslas-in-tunnels-opening?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hatched plans</a> in cities across the US to make traveling a lot less frustrating. It would do this by harnessing new tech to dig tunnels more efficiently and more cheaply than the status quo.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">But most of the company's projects have been stiff-armed by regulators and angry local residents. Plans for the Chicago Express Loop, linking downtown Chicago with O'Hare Airport, and a loop connecting DC and Baltimore both sputtered. So has a tunnel system connecting an LA train station and Dodger Stadium.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Skeptics question why Musk is digging tunnels to shuttle people around...when we already have something for that: It's called a subway. And it can ferry a lot more people than the Boring Company's system currently can.</p>
<ul style="line-height:22px">
<li aria-level="1"><span>The Boring Company's Loop in Las Vegas can transport up to 4,400 passengers per hour. A bus lane can move 8,000 people/hour and a subway line up to 100,000, per the National Association of Transportation Officials. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Still, if we know anything about Musk, it's that he regards his critics as a minor inconvenience easily swatted away. And the now-operational Las Vegas Loop is proof that, at least to an extent, he is capable of turning stuck-in-traffic musings into reality, even if it is "basically just Teslas in tunnels at this point," as Musk himself admitted.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Looking ahead...</strong>the Boring Company hopes to expand the convention center system to other Vegas landmarks and use it as a case study to build tunnels in other cities, such as Austin and Fort Lauderdale. Because if Musk wants to realize even a slice of his grand ambitions, what happens in Vegas, can't stay in...you get it. </p>

</h1>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Welcome to Open House, the only section of the newsletter that will make you say, “A tangerine tree in my backyard is what I've wanted all along.” We'll give you a few facts about a home listing and you try to guess the price.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><img src="https://media.giphy.com/media/17wOiAeGRkibNEawim/giphy.gif" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="1,712 square-foot house in Palm Springs" data-source="Zillow" data-reactroot=""></p>

Step inside the 1,712 square-foot hedge house with a beachy interior and a lot of tile to find:</p>

<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">$1.8 million</p>

Meme Battle
</h1>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Welcome back to Morning Brew's Meme Battle, where we crown a single memelord every Sunday.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Today's winner: </strong>Alberto in Turin, Italy. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><img src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NDE2L21lbWVfY29udGVzdF9qYWNrX3NwYXJyb3cuanBlZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiJ9" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt='A photo of the Jack Sparrow meme (a pirate running from a crowd that is chasing him with spears). Jack is labeled with the word "me" and the crowd behind him with the words "requests to register to webinars"' data-source="" data-reactroot=""></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;line-height: 22px;"><small> </small></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>This week's challenge: </strong>You can find the <a href="https://imgflip.com/memegenerator/Buff-Doge-vs-Cheems?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new meme template here</a> for next Sunday. Once you're done making your meme, <a href="https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/IbD75Lkx?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">submit it at this link</a>. We'll pick a new memelord for next week's Sunday Edition and provide you with another meme template to meme-ify. </p>

font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eGood morning. \u003c/strong\u003eA dispatch from the heartwarming news department: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eWhen travel was shutting down last spring, Delta pilot Chris Dennis parked a plane in the desert and left a note to the person who would fly it next.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eHey pilots, i\u003c/em\u003e\u003cem\u003et’s March 23rd and we just arrived from MSP. Very chilling to see so much of our fleet here in the desert. If you are here to pick it up then the light must be at the end of the tunnel. Amazing how fast it changed. Have a safe flight bringing it out of storage!\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eThe note was found 435 days later when another pilot brought the plane back into service last week.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;font-family:flood-std, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-weight:500\"\u003e—Neal Freyman\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE --\u003e\n\u003ctr class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003ctd align=\"left\" style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;font-size: 0px; border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Headshot of Yvonne Orji\" style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NDExL3l2b25uZV9vcmppLmpwZWciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\n\u003cem\u003eCourtesy of Yvonne Orji\u003c/em\u003e\n\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eIt's unclear what people talked about in group chats before \u003cem\u003eInsecure\u003c/em\u003e graced us with its hilarious plotlines, juicy drama, and, of course, Emmy-nominated Yvonne Orji. If you haven't finished the latest season, that's OK, because there are plenty of other places to find Orji: her HBO standup special from last summer, her new book \u003ca href=\"https://www.hachettebookgroup.com/titles/yvonne-orji/bamboozled-by-jesus/9781546012696/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eBamboozled By Jesus\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e, \u003c/em\u003eor her upcoming show for Disney+, \u003cem\u003eFirst Gen\u003c/em\u003e, that charts her experience growing up as a Nigerian immigrant in the US (her co-producer: Oprah).\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eWe asked the actor, writer, comedian, and producer a few icebreakers.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eYour character in \u003c/strong\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003eInsecure\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e, Molly, is so focused on her job that it interferes with her personal life. How do you, Yvonne, balance your personal life and career?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eThat's something that I'm just now starting to do. I'm where a lot of people want Molly to be, which is finding that balance. But self-care is my love language. I have standing massage appointments, therapy, all the things.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eIs there anything you're looking forward to doing after wrapping up \u003c/strong\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003eInsecure\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e and releasing your book?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eGirl, by the grace of God, I plan on being in Bali for a full month.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat's your pump-up song?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eBefore I went in to pitch my show for Oprah, back in 2015, my roommate was like, \"Do you have a hype song?\" I was so nervous. I was just trying to get my pitch down, but she was like, \"No, no, no, you need to have a song.\" And so I played \"I'm a Boss\" by Meek Mill on constant rotation. That was and has been my hype song for a long time.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eIf you could write anything on a billboard, what would it be?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\"Why not me?\" I would love to be in my car, feeling down, and then look up and see a billboard that says \"Why not me?\" You're right! Why not me?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHave you ever had a \"Why not me?\" moment?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eOh man. I still have those moments. Seeing that books like \u003ca href=\"https://www.purposedriven.com/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eThe Purpose Driven Life\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e or \u003ca href=\"https://www.thesecret.tv/products/the-secret-book/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eThe Secret\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e \u003c/em\u003esold like a gazillion million copies before the internet...I was like, if this older white man and this older white woman can sell gazillions of books [by] pretty much talking about faith, why not me?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat's a reality show you think you could win?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eLip Sync Battle\u003c/em\u003e. width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80Njg5L21ha2VfaXRfd29ya19sb2dvLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\n\u003cem\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\n\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eEach week, Morning Brew's Head of People Ops Kate Noel answers \u003ca href=\"https://link.morningbrew.com/click/23923023.14227/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJld2RhaWx5LnR5cGVmb3JtLmNvbS90by9mWTFDR3p5WT91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77B1c068d44?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereader-submitted questions\u003c/a\u003e about work in 2021. Today she's tag-teaming with Lily Mittman, our Director of Talent Acquisition.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHi! I’m actively interviewing for an entry-level marketing role and have been asked about salary expectations in the final round. How should I answer this question without negotiating myself down accidentally?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eComp questions can be really hard to navigate! I prefer to have these conversations upfront, because I want candidates to know they're interviewing for a position that they'd be excited to accept an offer for. The safest bet is to provide a salary range that would work for you. Think about what number you'd be comfortable walking away from as your low, and your slam-dunk-signing-the-offer-on-the-spot number as your high. You can always add in those magic words, \"negotiable!\"\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e —Lily \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eI find I am constantly overworked and lack a proper work-life balance. Everyone at the company also works a lot. How do I find my work-life balance at this company? I don’t want to leave.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eI feel you—work-life balance is something I struggle with also, but I’ve recently gotten better after this realization: “\u003cem\u003eNo one’s going to bite your head off if their email isn’t answered at 9pm\u003c/em\u003e.” You need to start setting expectations for yourself and for your coworkers that some parts of the day are off-limits for work matters. Once you decide what those are (for example, not opening your computer before 8:30am), you can use a variety of tools to broadcast to your coworkers that you’re actually living life, not pounding away at your keyboard. I use Slack away messages to tell folks that I’m not reachable, or I turn off Slack notifications at night.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eI think it’s very important you bring your work-life balance into ~balance~ because even if you don’t want to leave your company \u003cem\u003enow\u003c/em\u003e, you may want to leave in the future due to burnout. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e—Kate\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eSomething bothering you at work? \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://link.morningbrew.com/click/23923023.14227/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJld2RhaWx5LnR5cGVmb3JtLmNvbS90by9mWTFDR3p5WT91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77B1c068d44?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eAsk Kate here\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;border-collapse: collapse\" width=\"100%\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;padding-top: 12px\"\u003e\n\u003ca rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F06%2F11%2Fmake-work-balancing-work-life\" class=\"\"\u003e\u003cimg style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: inline-block; padding: 25px; word-break: break-word;\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv style=\"font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;\"\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left\"\u003e\nThe Boring Company Says \"Open Sesame\"\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/11/boring-company-says-open-sesame?utm_source=morning_brew\" style=\"text-decoration:none; border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"At a Boring Company debut in Las Vegas, a white Tesla sedan drives into a futuristic looking tunnel lit up blue on the inside.\" style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NDE1L2JvcmluZ19jb21wYW55LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\n\u003cem\u003eEthan Miller/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\n\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eAttendees at the World of Concrete convention in Las Vegas last week—the first major trade show since the pandemic began—made history in another way, too: They were among the first riders on the inaugural transportation system operated by The Boring Company, Elon Musk's grand vision for revolutionizing transit.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eIf you're envisioning futuristic pods that whisk travelers through high-tech underground tunnels at NASCAR speeds, as Elon Musk initially promised, the Las Vegas Convention Center Loop is \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnet.com/news/elon-musks-boring-loop-is-finally-transporting-passengers-in-las-vegas/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enot that\u003c/a\u003e. Human-driven Teslas shuttle visitors from one end of the vast complex to the other, reducing a 25-minute walk to a two-minute underground ride. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eIn all, it was a rather, uh, boring debut for the Boring Company, a venture Musk created after he became fed up with LA gridlock. \"Traffic is driving me nuts. Am going to build a tunnel boring machine and just start digging...\" he \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/810108760010043392?s=20\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etweeted\u003c/a\u003e in 2016.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eSo he did—or at least tried to. The Boring Company \u003ca href=\"https://www.fastcompany.com/90644133/elon-musk-boring-company-vegas-teslas-in-tunnels-opening?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehatched plans\u003c/a\u003e in cities across the US to make traveling a lot less frustrating. It would do this by harnessing new tech to dig tunnels more efficiently and more cheaply than the status quo.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eBut most of the company's projects have been stiff-armed by regulators and angry local residents. Plans for the Chicago Express Loop, linking downtown Chicago with O'Hare Airport, and a loop connecting DC and Baltimore both sputtered. So has a tunnel system connecting an LA train station and Dodger Stadium.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eSkeptics question why Musk is digging tunnels to shuttle people around...when we already have something for that: It's called a subway. And it can ferry a lot more people than the Boring Company's system currently can.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"line-height:22px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe Boring Company's Loop in Las Vegas can transport up to 4,400 passengers per hour. A bus lane can move 8,000 people/hour and a subway line up to 100,000, per the National Association of Transportation Officials. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eStill, if we know anything about Musk, it's that he regards his critics as a minor inconvenience easily swatted away. And the now-operational Las Vegas Loop is proof that, at least to an extent, he is capable of turning stuck-in-traffic musings into reality, even if it is \"basically just Teslas in tunnels at this point,\" as Musk himself admitted.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe Boring Company hopes to expand the convention center system to other Vegas landmarks and use it as a case study to build tunnels in other cities, such as Austin and Fort Lauderdale. Because if Musk wants to realize even a slice of his grand ambitions, what happens in Vegas, can't stay in...you get it. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;border-collapse: collapse\" width=\"100%\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;padding-top: 12px\"\u003e\n\u003ca rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F06%2F11%2Fboring-company-says-open-sesame\" class=\"\"\u003e\u003cimg style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: inline-block;
